agent.name: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Online copy: Artifacts: Leather case, with gold lettering "Dr. Walter Freeman" contains 2 TOL leucotomes (used for cutting white matter of the brain, was inserted beneath upper eyelid, through the skull to depth of 7cm and swung on a 20 degree medial arc and 30 degree lateral arc)

mods.mods:note: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University, 2130 H Street NW, Washington, 20052, United States of America (https://library.gwu.edu/scrc/contact)

div.LABEL: Online copy: Artifacts: Leather case, with gold lettering "Dr. Walter Freeman" contains 2 TOL leucotomes (used for cutting white matter of the brain, was inserted beneath upper eyelid, through the skull to depth of 7cm and swung on a 20 degree medial arc and 30 degree lateral arc)
